In Marketing We Trust

 

Digital Analyst

verified
Worldwide, APAC
The Position Summary

Title: Digital Analyst

Location: Remote. Based in APAC

Remuneration: Up to $7,000 AUD per month for the right candidate

Reports to: Managing Director, Frederic Chanut

Works on: Clients' projects and internal projects

Key objectives: Contribute to and grow our conversion research and testing services.

Skills and experience required:

Great experience with Google or Adobe analytics. (certification is a great plus)

Experience in using data to identify actionable opportunities or insights

Love numbers and a passion to use numbers to improve business performance


Skills and experience (good to have):

Experimental mindset - love to push boundaries and try new things

Experience in planning, conducting and analysing experiments result in a digital environment

Some knowledge into experiment framework


The Company

We are a digital analytics Agency and we are very good at Analytics, SEO, CRO, Data Science. Find out more about our services


Our motto: Traffic is nice. Revenue is better.


We have the most fun doing it in competitive environments such as finance, education, jobs, insurance, automotive and many more.


We strive on being an extension of our client’s team and providing tailor-made, return-focused work.

We are picky about the clients we bring on-board and very protective of our reputation. We won’t engage with a firm unless we believe we can make a difference to their business and help them Get Stuff Done!


This stops us from taking on board demoralising projects and having us hating our jobs and our clients.

We think the current agency model is broken and we really believe we can build a better alternative. But we need great people to help make this happen and that’s where you come in!


We are a bootstrapped company, we grew exponentially in the last few years and now seating at 60 people working with us.

We are built to be remote from day 1, but if you want to say ‘Hello’, our office is 78 meters from the beach in Sydney. Make sure you bring your swimwear!



The Role

You'll take responsibility for end-to-end optimisation coverage; you identify opportunities through analytics data, analyse customer journeys to understand customers’ behavior and estimate potential uplift of proposed tests. Working across multiple projects and clients, you will be responsible for analysing test results on a regular basis, supporting the wider CRO team through your insights and recommendations.




The Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate Digital Analyst to join our growing team. The Digital Analyst will work on multiple client projects in support of our broader team to contribute to and grow our conversion research and testing services.


You will need a mix of creativity and strong analytical skills to identify website optimisation opportunities for our clients. You will support to develop and execute strategies and help turn those ideas into an optimisation and testing plan.


You should have enough statistical and analytical abilities to help us understand data in a way that results in actionable suggestions for our clients.


If you have a great understanding of how traffic and audiences are built, of what it takes to incrementally drive improvements to user experience and conversion rates, we want you!

Responsibilities
You'll have a data-driven approach to optimisation, with a solid technical understanding of web analytics and CRO tools, your day to day activities will include:

Analyze quantitative and qualitative data including web, CRM, user testing, polls etc.

Use your findings to present actionable recommendations and test ideas to drive the best possible user experience
Interpret data, identify key findings, and make recommendations based on testing results.

Understanding customer journeys and struggles through analysis like purchase funnel analysis and heat mapping
Identify potential areas of improvement on the website based on Adobe/Google Analytics data

Help define and recommend measurements, strategies, and reporting using data to drive valuable business decisions

Collaborate with CRO team on strategy, testing roadmaps and test hypotheses

Support in designing A/B and Multivariate tests including quality assurance process.

Monitor and continuously evaluate your ideas and designs through development and production phases

Effectively communicate and demonstrate your ideas and concepts to all stakeholders, this could include both technical and non-technical audiences



Ideal candidate

Experience running analysis using web analytics tools like Google Analytics (Adobe Analytics is a plus)

Passion in using data to understand user behaviour and pain points

Experience in extracting and interpreting tests

Good understanding of CRO (Conversion Rate Optimisation) framework

Excellent analytical skills

Ability to clearly communicate data

Detail oriented & organized

Willingness and ability to learn


Attributes and behaviours we love to see
A can-do attitude

Ownership of your work

Inquisitive

Analytical

Creative in context

Results orientated

Collegiate and supportive

A sense of humour

What we offer you
Career progression is based on your ability to deliver and drive ideas and difference for both the client and the company, not your ability to play politics or by the cut of your suit (in fact, we have a no suit policy).



A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you a unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.



We even fly the team each year to our awesome TrustEDConf event. The last one was in October in Borneo.

An important point that is often overlooked: you will be truly part of a team. For most remote workers, you can easily feel isolated from what's happening in the business. We take good care of our teammates. So much so that a person who joined our team late November told us recently that she has felt more part of a team, than when she was working in an office.



Don't take our word for it. Check what our teammates are saying on glassdoor (yep, 2 reviews are not great, but most are).



The Application Process
-----------------------

Fill up the form. Submission is generally reviewed within 3-5 working days.

Submit the answers to our short pre-interview assessment.

Do some short tests (typically 1-3 hours max), live case scenarios giving you an opportunity to see exactly what we do and how we do it

Review of tests

Interview with CRO Lead and Managing Director

Offer and Contract drafted, review signed, Happy dance ensue

Now, here is step 1, time to tell us a bit about yourself.

- Worldwide, APAC

items.content:
What we do

We’re a tech for good business, making care easier for everyone – care workers, agencies, people receiving care and their families.

At our core, we make care management software. Our dedicated mobile app helps care workers to manage all of their schedules, reporting, and client information quickly, so they can spend less time on admin and more time with their clients.

Our web tools helps care agencies to make their operations more efficient, safeguard their clients and care workers, keep data secure, and keep the regulators happy.

Finally we keep the care recipient's family closer to their loved one's care with text message updates, and their own login to review all the care notes as the visits happen.

However, for us this is just the beginning. We want to become a global brand and software platform, supporting the care industry in the UK and around the world. To do that we'll turn our 'software as a service' business into a marketplace for care, helping providers to market themselves, and families to find care that's right for them in their local area.

We've come a long way already: we're now live with over 100 care providers around the UK, but we still have an incredibly exciting journey ahead of us. Join us on our mission to transform the care market through technology!

A day in the life of our Product Designer

We need someone who's keen to tackle some big design challenges, solve real-world user problems, and do some good for society along the way. You'll take responsibility for leading all design activities, primarily development of the product (mobile and web applications), but also owning and evolving the company’s brand identity and tone. Essentially you'll be owning everything that design touches, including:

• Prototyping and final product design
• Owning and evolving the brand and design/style guides
• Website design
• Marketing materials and business cards
• Customer communications
• Growing the design team

You'll love working with us if

• You take pride in working on tech that does real good in the world
• You enjoy working in a relaxed environment but don’t compromise on deadlines
• You are excited about pushing the limits of traditional systems and old ways of thinking
• You want to be part of a small but dedicated team of problem-solving experts with an open communication culture contributing to the wider business goals
• You’re great at managing your own time, as well as coordinating and communicating with others
• You spot where things need to be improved and take initiative to find ways to make those improvements
• You can tolerate occasional puns that are so bad they need to be explained, and you don't hate Beyoncé

What we offer

• Competitive compensation package
• Onsite restaurant-style break area with free coffee and refreshments
• Free team lunch on Fridays
• Flexible work environment with opportunity to work from home once per week
• All the tech you need to get your work done including a MacBook Pro
• High degree mentoring with our CEO through your own tailored development plan
• 32 days of holiday (incl. bank holidays)

Design skills

We’re looking for an inquisitive risk-taking designer, who can lead the design activities across the product and business, shaping both what we do and how we do it.

• Expertise in modern design tools, predominantly Sketch
• Ability to produce rapid prototypes in appropriate fidelity for the situation
• Ability to consider the end to end user flow, but critically the ability to
then design the final user interface to make that flow a reality
• Ability to condense complex processes into simple, clean designs
• Ideally been involved in or led brand development efforts and bringing
brand values into the product and service design
• Ideally has previously taken products from conception to release and
beyond

Communication skills

• Ability to create quick 'best-guess' designs when time is short, and apply more detailed research when more research time is available
• Experience leading user testing efforts and distil outputs and data into tangible actions
• Experience involving engineering and product in design discussions

Leadership skills

• Interest in new design trends and styles
• Ability to prioritise work to hit deadlines
• Evangelism and thought leadership within the design community

If you want to be known for the products and brand that revolutionised elderly care, then we want to speak to you.

Overview

DESCRIPTION – Performance Marketing Manager – FinTech

Currently recruiting in London

My client is a fast-growing FinTech that is on a mission to make running a small business simple. Their vision is that every small business has their accounting and banking in one place. They are a challenger bank and an early stage start-up with ambitious plans for growth. They have just closed their Series A funding. This is not a corporate environment, and you can expect to be exposed to many areas of the business, with opportunities to improve and impact how they work.

This is a fast paced role, which comes with a good level of responsibility from day one, so you’ll be a competent digital acquisition professional who thrives in a busy, target driven environment. The team you’ll be joining contributes a huge amount to the overall turnover of the business, so you must be results-driven and focused on generating a strong ROI. This is the first in-house Performance Marketing role so is perfect for somebody who is looking for their next step up. Progression opportunities include having a direct impact on business strategy & scaling a team.

  • Responsible for the optimisation and growth of all performance channels
  • Analysing current and ongoing campaign performance to identify both incremental and step changes in performance and ROI as well as driving new areas of growth
  • Set, manage and execute PPC and Paid Social strategy, planning, tracking, optimisation and reporting, analysis and optimisation
  • Identify opportunities to improve and scale performance through new techniques, technology and efficiency gains
  • Help solve challenges around attribution
  • Design and run experiments to prove hypotheses
  • Forecasting channel performance and costs

Key Requirements for the Performance Marketing Manager – FinTech

  • Passionate about Digital Marketing and passionate about making a real contribution to a growing business

  • 3 or more years experience within a similar role – PPC campaign management, SEO etc
  • You have ideally worked in a start-up/ Tech / FinTech

Not only will you have the opportunity to make a huge impact at one of the UK’s leading Fintechs, you’ll also have access to

  • Share options after 6 months tenure
  • 32 paid days holiday and the ability to work from home
  • Based in Huckletree West, with an interesting mix of other startups and an extensive programme of talks and events available
  • Regular Thursday team socials as well as celebrations for milestones

items.content:
Community Engagement Specialist, Social Media at Twilio

Remote

Location: Remote

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where and Why

Twilio is looking for a passionate digital connector to help us create compelling content and build community with our growing audience of developers and customers on social media. This person will help us amplify the Twilio story and help us expand our reach on new and emerging digital platforms. This individual will join a growing global Corporate Communications function that’s sharing the creative ways developers are building great customer experiences with APIs.

Who?

  • Enjoys engaging and building community on social media.
  • Has 2-3 years experience running social media in B2B or B2C.
  • Has experience with Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, reddit, HackerNews, Quora, and other developer platforms.
  • Keeps up-to-date on what’s #trending and can have complete conversations with emojis and gifs.
  • Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication skills and is able to express complex thoughts or ideas in 280 characters or less. (again, emojis and gifs are a plus).
  • Loves to collaborate with a diverse team and work toward common goals.
  • Is passionate to connect people and deliver timely, empathetic responses.

What?

Twilio’s presence on social media is undergoing a major transition as we build our strategy to engage with our growing community of customers and developers that span the globe. You’ll get to play a part in shaping how we communicate on social media and partner with teams across our company to help spread the Twilio Magic. As with most social media roles, each day can be wildly different and bring you new opportunities to flex your social media skills. An engaging day includes:

  • Proactively listening to and engaging in conversations that are happening about Twilio and our products on social media.
  • Being alert of trends on social and coming up with creative ways we can engage with them.
  • Strategizing with product and marketing counterparts for how we communicate product releases, news, and updates.
  • Working with our support team to triage customer issues and questions, ensuring we’re delivering timely and helpful responses.
  • Developing and designing creative assets.
  • Collaborating on editorial calendars and managing posts on our social media channels.

Why?

Driving awareness to a broad audience is a key element of Twilio’s marketing strategy and social media plays a large role in that. In addition to our own platforms, we’ve invested in equipping our entire company with tools and best practices to be our advocates on their personal platforms. Twilio is a dynamic and fast-paced culture where continually innovating and creating new strategies for growing awareness is required.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we’re dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

While working remote, you will still enjoy our incredible perks: monthly Kindle book reimbursement, monthly gym reimbursement, unlimited PTO, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world’s communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer’s toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Senior Product Designer

New York City

full-time

About Us

Truly premium content. At true scale. Only CBSi. CBS Interactive is the premier online content network for information and online operations of CBS Corporation as well as some of the top native digital brands in the entertainment industry. Our brands dive deep into the things people care about across entertainment, technology, news, games, business, and sports. With over 1 billion users visiting our properties every quarter, we are a global top 10 web property and one of the largest premium content networks online.

Check us out on The Muse to get an inside look into #LifeAtCBSi through employee testimonials, office photos, and company updates.

CBS Sports, one of the largest premium US sports properties, is seeking a talented Senior Product Designer. Someone who is excited about designing cross-platform experiences with immense visibility for millions of passionate sports fans. We are presently at a formative period of innovation, pushing into new markets, extending our digital streams, experimenting with AR and redefining world-class sports fan experiences.

Is this you?

You are passionate about making delightful, innovative work and committed to growing the talents of more junior team members. You relish the challenge of a white piece of paper, driving novel concepts and developing a strong creative vision. You love design systems, work daily to stay current with the industry (nobody can ever get to the end of their design reading and podcast lists!) and love continually poking/pushing visual design forward year after year. You know strong relationships are core to launching world-class products. Furthermore, you are endlessly motivated by seeing your work make it into the user’s hands and follow your designs every step of the way.

What You Bring
  • 5+ years of Visual Design experience working on consumer-facing mobile and web experiences.
  • A creative portfolio of previous design work, demonstrating empathy for users.
  • Strong beliefs, loosely held; with a willingness to defend your design decisions yet also have your opinion changed.
  • Strong visual design sense, clean command over interaction design, typography and usability.
  • You have the ability to communicate design decisions clearly and effectively across all functions and levels.
  • Desire or experience collaborating, iterating, and testing with Product and Engineering to discover the solutions that exceed user expectations.
The Team

CBS Sports has a nimble creative design team distributed across NYC, Kansas City, Cameron Park, Nashville, and Fort Lauderdale. We span multiple brands under the CBS Sports umbrella including Max Preps, 24⁄7 Sports, Sportsline, Sports HQ & Fantasy. We believe in strong design systems and continually iterate our collective design DNA. User research is at the center of everything we push and work tirelessly to continually improve our understanding of our users.Sport is entertaining, passionate, fun and exciting. We try to emulate the same experience in our office culture. We believe designers have a core seat at the table and carve out time each week for innovation/self-led design projects.

Couple of exciting things we’re working on:- Roku, FireTV and connected TV Apps for our new digital streaming experience.- CBS Sports iOS and Android Apps.- Data-rich sports game tracker and scoreboard experiences.- Personalized sports video tools.- Design partnerships with Apple, Google, Roku and Amazon on large scale projects. Shh!- Interesting design opportunities across our fantasy games.

The team doesn’t stop there! We are part of the larger CBS Interactive family that extends across CBS News, Entertainment, CNET and Gamespot teams, plus many more exciting brands. We meet regularly, exchange ideas, discuss industry-wide challenges and take part in company-wide hack-days/design-days. This extended family allows for endless growth opportunities both within the company and the wider design community. We want all CBS designers to be industry leaders and will support speaking opportunities, workshops and company organized meetups.

Our Culture

We pride ourselves on being a great place to work. Whether that’s team social events within the sports group (company sporting events, after work meetups) or the wider CBS family with monthly company events (the last one was a pride celebration), free bagels in the office on Friday, popcorn Wednesdays, movie screenings (psst: advanced screening for Avengers: Endgame!)and cold coffee on tap all summer long! Furthermore, we offer fantastic benefits from weeklong winter breaks, to paid-time off, summer Fridays, tuition assistance, wellness programs, and even perks for your four-legged friends.

All candidates must successfully complete a background check prior to starting employment at CBS Interactive. CBS Interactive is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or status as a veteran. CBS Interactive complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Job description

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only considering candidates based within European or African timezones.

We’re looking for someone who loves to turn data into insights and communicate findings fearlessly. You want to help teams make data-informed decisions and take data-informed actions, you have a curious mindset and are motivated to understand our business better.

You will work within our marketing team to make data-driven recommendations on strategy and keep a finger on the pulse of our business. You will analyze the effectiveness of our paid and content campaigns, analyze lead and customer segments and cohorts, assure our marketing tools are communicating effectively, and much more.

You will:

  • Evaluate the performance of our go-to-market strategy by analyzing funnels and metrics

  • Analyze data from multiple systems to provide a full funnel view of the performance of marketing channels and the content we promote.

  • Monitor the state of marketing initiatives and produce data-driven hypotheses and communicate insights

  • Help the marketing team to better understand their functional areas, improve familiarity with and use of data, set the bar for analytics

  • Present analysis based recommendations to project leaders and teams to shape decision making

  • Build data models to accelerate the business by providing deeper insights into visitor and customer behaviours, and feed the team’s hunger for actionable insights

  • Select and integrate new technologies to promote better segmentation and attribution

  • Work with lead and customer data to create impactful visualization and insight reports to fuel demand projects.

  • Understand our marketing tool stack, assure seamless communication and align it with our needs to improve data collection and quality.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of work experience in analytics/data science or a directly related field – some of which is in a technology environment

  • Experience initiating and delivering applicable analyses/recommendations to guide impact

  • Experience with building predictive data models to provide deeper insights

  • Excellent skills with analytics tools, fluency with BI/visualization tools such as Mode, and knowledge of Excel, R, Python,  SQL, or other analysis tools

  • An understanding of SaaS business models and essential metrics

  • Experience implementing and integrating a marketing automation platform

  • Critical reasoning skills, including the understanding of common pitfalls of data analysis

  • A desire to work in a respectful, transparent, and transparent work environment, following Hotjar’scompany values, culture and ways of working

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third-party


What we offer

  • A remote and accomplished diverse and international team.
  • An opportunity to positively impact people’s experience online and make the web a better place.
  • Annual learning and development budget.
  • Several perks designed for your well-being and a healthy work-life balance. (Holiday Budget, Wellbeing Allowance, Working Together Budget, 16 weeks paid parental leave, and much more).

Compensation

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 - €70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to our new team member will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta and Germany (for candidates who don’t require visa sponsorship). All other new team members will join as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

items.content:
What's the opportunity?
-----------------------
We're looking for an experienced Product Designer to help us support the way businesses, do business. You will be joining a very product focused team and will own design throughout the product development cycle - from new ideas all the way to implementations. If you’re passionate about the craft and process of building an exciting product from the ground up and working with great people, you’ll fit right in.

Who are we?
-------------
CreditDigital allows vendors to provide an instant finance option to their business customers at online checkout or point-of-sale. Business customers can then design their own terms to fit their budget and cashflow. We are trying to solve a massive problem in the B2B world and we are very excited to be amongst the first ones tackling it.

What will you be doing?
------------------------
As the first designer in the company, you will have the opportunity to set up the standards in how the design process works. As a product team, we trust each individual to be autonomous and work towards are shared goals. We are fully committed in supporting one another in any way possible.

* Act as a champion that drives product ideas from start to completion: from research insights, to workflows all the way to visual designs.
* Sketch and prototype ideas to quickly access viability, and design the fine grained details of interactions.
* Iterate based on feedback from the whole team.
* Work closely with engineers as they build and ship ideas.

What skills and experience do I need?
------------------------------------
We are looking for product designers that have done this before. You will be designer #1 which is very exciting and you will get to set the tone of our product.

* Experience designing digital products and systems (styleguides), not just websites. You have helped ship products.
* An appreciation of the entire product development process, from problem solving through to detailed UI and visual design.
* The ability to create mockups of your designs.
* Excellent communicator that can articulate the thought behind proposals.
* Able to collaborate with the engineers and the wider company on strategy and delivery.

Where will I be working from?
-----------------------------
Normally you will be working from our Angel offices (right next to the station) but we are a remote friendly bunch so you can adjust your schedule as you see fit.

What would I be paid?
----------------------
Our pay is within the top 10% of the industry, for the matched role and experience, based on London rates. According to the market at the moment, we aim to pay £70,000 for the role.

Salary is not everything. Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived away from work. We don't offer free beers or Coke on tap but rather:

* 25 days off per annum plus bank holidays.
* 35 hours / week. Normal working hours are between 10am – 6pm.
* Work from home whenever. If you prefer to come to the office everyday that’s great, if you prefer to work from home 4 times a week that’s fantastic. Whatever works for you. As a team we will make sure you are not missing out by pushing remote first practices. Flexibility to adjust your daily hours. Visiting friends and family in another country, going to the bank or the gym, you only need to have an overlap between our core hours (12am – 4pm) for 6 hours. As an example, you can start at 8am and finish at 4pm or 12am and finish at 8pm.

How to apply?
--------------
Where you have previously worked does not really matter. If you have a Linkedin profile, just to have a more general idea, send it through, no CV is needed in that case. Instead, send us through a cover letter where you explain more about your experience. We would like you to express:

* What have you worked on that you are the most proud of?
* What do you enjoy working on the most?
* How do you approach the design process?
* What would you like to work on here?

In the interview process we will go through a particular piece of work (your choice) that you have delivered, detailing the approach around it, challenges and learnings. We're looking for a feature/research that clearly outlines the problems you were tackling with your design work. It should touch on the process you applied to tackling the challenges, rather than focusing just on visuals and landing pages. We would like to go through from inception to interactions and the visual design. The work should ideally focus on designing software products.

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company.

What does “established” mean?

How you’ll do this:

  5. For qualified prospects, you’ll book a Discovery call with the Account Executive who will be responsible for moving the sales opportunity forward in the sales process and closing the deal. By the way, in your job application response, cover letter, or email application, start with “colorful unicorn” so we know you read all of this.

Requirements

To be successful in the role, you should meet the below:

  1. (required) High speed reliable internet with ability to conduct voice calls over the internet (we use ringcentral.com).
  2. (required) Ability to work in US timezone for first 3-6 months of the role, specifically in US PST. Specific schedule will be discussed during interviews.

Senior Product Manager (Price Comparison)

United Kingdom, Nottinghamshire
Company: Experian

Overview

A new exciting opportunity for Experian HD Decisions, we are looking for a strategic product leader to join our Nottingham (City Centre) team. We are currently recruiting a Head of Product for our Price Comparison product . This is a brilliant opportunity for someone with strong analytical competencies who wants to broaden their career within a FTSE 50, market leading organisation.

T he role


As the Head of Product, you will be responsible for a number of areas which include, being accountable for the strategic development of the product roadmap by ensuring it is clearly defined, updated in line with market needs. Ensure that good client / consumer outcomes are at the center of all your decision making. Develop and effectively implement ‘Go to market’ plans, working cross-functionally to ensure successful execution.

You will own and drive the product plan, pricing strategy, development budget and roadmap. Take reasonable steps to ensure that the business area complies with the relevant requirements and standards of the regulatory system and develop trusted relationships across the wider Experian organisation is key as you will need to facilitate the execution of the product strategy.

Could this be the role for you?

This is a great opportunity for an experienced product leader to manage and launch new products, and have an influential role across our business.

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about shaping the future success of rapidly growing FinTech area of Experian. It is essential that you can demonstrate relevant experience in a senior portfolio/product management role, with a track record of commercial and/or technical achievement, revenue growth and cost reduction. You must have significant experience in managing products and launching new. You will need to be a strategic thinker and able to define the maintenance and development of the roadmap for your product. Being able to build a business case, using financial models is required. It would be a bonus if you have previous experience of P&L management and able to own the analytical/insight agenda that underpins your product.

Why choose us?
Our colleagues’ health and wellbeing is a top priority for us, that’s why our reward, benefits and wellbeing programmes are designed so you can come to work feeling your very best self. Our benefits focus on health, money and lifestyle so you can tailor your benefits to your own personal needs. Whether it’s your physical and mental wellness, getting to work or planning for the future, we have a range of flexible options to have you covered!
We are committed to building an inclusive culture and to creating an environment where people can balance successful careers with their commitments and interests outside of work. Our flexible working practices support our belief that this balance brings long-lasting benefits for our business as well as our people. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, and if this is important to you, we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

Who are Experian?
We unlock the power of data to create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. At life’s big moments – from buying a home or car, to sending a child to university, to growing a business exponentially by connecting it with new customers – we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence so they can maximize every opportunity.
For more than 125 years, we’ve helped consumers and clients prosper, and economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done.

Our 17,000 people in 37 countries believe the possibilities for you, and our world, are growing. We’re investing in new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow.

Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with Experian.
To learn more about our culture and what it’s really like to work here, check out our LinkedIn and social media channels using the hashtags #ExperianLife and #ExperianWay.

Product Marketing Manager

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: The Democratic National Committee
Full Time

Overview

The Democratic National Committee’s Tech team is hiring a to help us build world class tools to help candidates win elections and to empower progressives across the country by providing them with access to high quality data and tools they need to win.

Product Marketing Manager 

We need an experienced Product Marketing Manager to help us define and communicate our value proposition for our data warehouse and suite of self service analytics tools we are building for our growing community of data analysts and data scientists in state parties, campaigns, sister committees (like the DCCC), and vendors.

This role is the glue that binds our product strategy to the tactics we need to drive success in marketing and communications to achieve results. You will be the product evangelist and will play an integral role in organizing product releases and linking arms with our community team to ensure consistent and clear customer messaging and support.

Who we are

The Tech team is a small, diverse team that provides the technology used by candidates and organizers in all 50 states and all 3,413 counties across the United States to analyze data, organize campaigns, raise money, and get out the vote on election day. But there’s more to do. So we’re hiring product managers, engineers, researchers, designers, security experts, IT professionals, and data scientists who can use user-centered design and rapid iteration to develop a rich technology ecosystem for progressives—building tools ourselves as well as partnering with other companies and organizations.

The Product

Our data warehouse and analytics tools is our product (‘Phoenix’). We are deeply committed to equipping candidates and campaigns around the country with the resources they need to win, and we are seeking a Product Marketing Manager to collaborate with our product and community teams to identify the highest value opportunities to improve users’ end to end experience with democratic data.

Our users range in technical skill and it’s our mission to build tools that help analysts and data scientists uplevel their analytics game by providing features and functions that seamlessly integrate with our data warehouse.

You Will..
  • Define our value proposition – With your deep understanding of the needs and challenges that our customers are facing today, you will define differentiated value propositions to accelerate the adoption of Phoenix.
  • Develop strategy and execution for all customer communications. This includes product releases, weekly updates and much more.
  • Influence our roadmap – Influence the product strategy and in-product communications through relevant consumer and product insights, driving alignment across teams when needed.
  • Showcase our solution – Build ‘wow’ and ‘how to’ content and go to market activities to excite, delight and onboard presidentials, state parties, sister committees and vendors to Phoenix.
  • Support and coordinate the efforts of internal cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Data, Engineers, Community, UX Design, and others.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our products and the development work that is happening each sprint.
  • Be a key resource for customers such as state party data directors, sister committee analysts and presidential data teams.
  • Develop relationships with customers across the political tech ecosystem.

    • You might be right for this role if you..
    • Have a minimum 5+ years of relevant work experience in fields such as product marketing, integrated marketing, product management, management consulting, communications or technical pre-sales.
    • Have a Bachelors degree in marketing, business, technology, computer science or relevant field of studyHave a demonstrated track record in crafting compelling positioning and marketing content.
    • Have experience partnering with, influencing, and driving buy-in from product teams (Product Management, Design, Engineering, UX Research, Data Science).
    • Comfortable with one or more of the following: SQL, data architecture, data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Periscope, Google Data Studio).
    • Have strong written and verbal communication skills, and experience distilling key functionality and benefits into product marketing message.
    • Are curious, collaborative, and humble – ready to work with a diverse, distributed team to solve interesting problems together
    • Deep knowledge of and passion for technology products.

      • Nice to have..
      • Electoral campaign experience, and specifically experience with political data, is not required, but is definitely a plus.
      • Experience with front-end programming
      • Experience managing numerous stakeholders and large cross-functional teams
      • Experience working with a remote team

        • Do you want to..
        • Secure the future of our country? Right now a lot is at stake in our country and our team has a huge opportunity to make a real difference.
        • Work with amazing people? We’re building a diverse, distributed team, hiring the best people we can wherever they are—alumni from past Presidential campaigns working out of DC and New York, experienced product developers from the SF Bay Area, and more.
        • Never stop learning? There are people who know about politics and people who know about technology and a few who have figured out some things about how to combine the two, but we are blazing new trails and you should be comfortable exploring and learning from everyone you can.

          • This is a full-time role. We are a remote team with a concentration of folks in Washington, D.C., San Francisco Bay Area, Boston and Chicago. If you are coming from industry, however, be aware that some things are different in the world of politics: while we’ve done some budget hacking so we can be competitive when it comes to salaries we know we can’t beat Google or Facebook. On the other hand, you might legit help save the world.

          The Democratic National Committee (DNC), is committed to diversity among its staff, and recognizes that its continued success requires the highest commitment to obtaining and retaining a diverse staff that provides the best quality services to supporters and constituents. The DNC is an equal opportunity employer and it is our policy to recruit, hire, train, promote and administer any and all personnel actions without regard to sex, race, age, color, creed, national origin, religion, economic status, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity or expression, ethnic identity or disability, or any other legally protected basis. The DNC is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in the hiring process and on the job, as required by applicable law. The DNC will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination and any such conduct is strictly prohibited.

items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Designer
Anywhere
Company: Shopify
Full Time

Overview

At Shopify, we care deeply about making commerce better for everyone. This mission began when our founders started an online business selling snowboards. Existing software was expensive and so hard to use that it made their dream of entrepreneurship feel impossible. So, they changed their focus and started developing Shopify to enable anyone with something to sell to easily start, run, and grow their business.

Today, Shopify empowers more than 800,000+ merchants from all over the world to succeed at entrepreneurship. Our mission is ambitious and we’re looking for great people to join us. You’ll join Shopify’s growing UX team of 450+ Designers, Content Strategists, UX Researchers, and UX Developers, who play a key role in building understanding and empathy for merchants.

About the role:

As a Senior Product Designer, you will be responsible for end-to-end UX projects within the Shopify Home team under our Core Foundations group. Core teams are focused on building the Foundations of everything Shopify does to make both the platform and other teams at Shopify work better, faster, stronger. The Home team is responsible for the first interface a merchant sees when they log into our software.

This is a multifaceted role, where you’ll be responsible not only for product design (including sketching, wire-framing, low and high fidelity prototyping) but also contributing to the product vision and roadmap, working on synthesizing and summarizing findings across multiple data sources, helping and working closely with content strategist on content tasks (the product you’ll be working on is all about communication), and stewarding product and UX conversation with senior leadership.

What you’ll be working on:
  • Owning projects from start to finish while leading various UX initiatives including planning, content mapping, sketching, wire-framing, low and high fidelity prototyping and leading stakeholder reviews
  • Collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of designers, content strategists, UX researchers, developers, and product managers to explore, prototype, test, and ship the best possible experience for our merchants
  • Working with our data scientists and UX Researchers to identify optimal methodology and tooling based on project objectives and constraints
  • Being data-driven; synthesizing and summarizing findings to inform product and UX decisions
  • Mentoring others across various UX disciplines, levelling up the team and helping evolve our tools and best practices to continually grow and improve the discipline.
  • Collaborating with content strategists, defining and evolving editorial, voice and tone, standards across our product.
  • Identifying, championing and developing opportunities for new product functionalities to continuously improve future iterations of the product.
  • Sharing and reviewing designs based on peer feedback, user research, testing, and merchant feedback

    • Requirements for the role:
    • Passion for solving product problems while balancing all facets of UX (strategy and research, information architecture, interaction design, data analysis, content modelling, and high fidelity visuals)
    • Experience collaborating closely with product, engineering, content, and research
    • Ability to provide high-level design strategy and visionEmploy a user-centered design process to support the overall business strategy
    • Seek out and leverage the insights from our research and analytics teams to inform your designs
    • Experience with organizing large amounts of information to ensure it’s easy to understand, find, and interpret on any device
    • Experience working closely with content strategy, information architecture, and/or editorial processes
    • Ability to clearly communicate insights and provide recommendations to various stakeholders including, but not limited to, senior leadership
    • Experience working in a fast-paced experimental or start-up environment collaborating with remote team members
    • Proficiency with current industry design and collaboration tools such as Sketch, Figma, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Github
    • Ability to step away from technology for sketching ideas and lo-fi prototypes
    • Staying on top of emerging UI standards and trends.

      • We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. Holly is looking forward to reading your application. If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce around the world, send us a few samples of your work: portfolio, wireframes, UX flows, publications, or whatever represents what you do best.

      This posting will close on 

       July 15th at 9 am EDT.

      At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

items.content:
Technical Product Manager at Aledade

Remote
  • Technology / Data Analytics
  • Bethesda, MD, USA

We are actively recruiting for a Technical Product Manager who works within our Product Management team. The ACO Management Technical Product Manager is a key member of the team that helps to design technical, analytic and process solutions to support Aledades internal ACO management organization. Who also works alongside business owners, data analysts, designers, engineers, and stakeholders to define tech-enabled problems, solution design, implementation approach and rollout plans. They are the interface between strategic business owners and execution team and ensure that Aledade creates a high-quality product with the ability to scale

Within Aledade, we are a team of business owners, software developers, designers and product managers that build, implement and maintain a web-based application that transforms data from multiple sources into high-value, actionable insights. This application is used by strategic leadership, internal ACO executive directors, and the field support teams to monitor and manage ACO and practice performance in the realm of value-based reimbursement.

This position will be full time, and includes full benefits and an equity option. We are open to remote, US-based candidates.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with ACOM business owner and stakeholders to cultivate a shared vision for the problem space, constraints, priorities and ideal end state, and be able to articulate and advocate for this perspective.
  • Work with internal teams and end users to develop a deep understanding of requirements, perform thoughtful solution design, use data to test hypotheses, and support teams throughout execution.
  • Write detailed user stories for new projects, capturing detailed descriptions of business rationale, requirements, and success criteria that are defined by measurable outcomes.
  • Participate in daily stand ups, demo days, sprint retros and PM/PO coordination meetings.
  • Develop short- and long-term roadmaps that deliver maximum value with minimum risk and assume ongoing iteration.
  • Review support issues related to projects and monitor utilization and expected outcomes.

Basic Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 yr product management experience in technology, technology-enabled services industry, or a SaaS product.
  • Experience using data and primary research to inform solution design and build internal business understanding.
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills, with an emphasis on problem-solving and building subject matter expertise.
  • Experience with and understanding of the software development lifecycle and software development methodologies. Preferably experience with participating in Agile / Scrum teams.

Preferred Experience

Product development experience in the context of the development of a healthcare technology product, especially with clinical and staff end users.

  • Product management experience in the context of an account management or client performance product, especially geared towards financial, sales or operational efficiency goals.
  • Knowledge of healthcare administrative and clinical data sets, including demographic, financial and clinical data.
  • Basic understanding of healthcare administrative or clinical workflows for inpatient, ambulatory or ancillary services.
  • Experience working with population health or CRM products, such as Salesforce.
  • Experience with clinical quality measurement and corresponding data sets.
  • Knowledge of SQL, ideally with PostgreSQL experience.
  • Knowledge of alternative payment models related to primary care such as MSSP ACOs, Pioneer ACOs, commercial insurance shared savings programs, PCMH.

Who is Aledade? We are a healthcare services startup, backed by Venrock, ARCH Venture Partners, Google Ventures, Biomatics Capital Partners, and the Maryland Venture Fund. We are intent on creating healthcare that is better for patients and doctors, at a lower cost. We assist independent primary care physicians in managing the transition to value based care, initially through the creation of accountable care organizations. We are public health-motivated, data-driven, and relentless. We are creating a state-of-the-art cloud based technology stack to foster population health in our practices.

At Aledade, we dont just accept differences, we celebrate them. We strive to attract, develop, and retain highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities where we live and work. Aledade is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions at Aledade are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical condition related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity or expression, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills are a must
  • Broad understanding of computer-science and software development principles and practices suitable for senior level contribution in an exceptionally complex project

  • Ease and familiarity in coordinating distributed work using git & Github in a Continuous Integration context
  • Able to quickly learn and contribute in a fast-paced remote distributed working environment, sharing knowledge and seeking feedback

items.content:
Marketing Manager at Gatsby

Remote

About Gatsby

Gatsby is an open-source, modern website generator that builds performance into every website by leveraging the latest web technologies such as React and GraphQL. We make it easy for developers to create fast, compelling websites without needing to become a performance expert. We are a VC-backed startup with a solid open source community (over 30,000 stars on Github). Our core values include transparency (we work in public most of the time); creating a safe, high-trust team; building incredible developer experiences; maintaining a healthy working environment; and helping deliver web experiences that feel amazing to use on every device and connection type.

We provide full-time employees with full benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage with available coverage for spouses or domestic partners and children, stock options, 401(k), generous holiday and sick paid time off, and 3 months of parental leave covering both adoption and foster placement.

Details of this role:

  • Type of work: Full-time
  • Start date: Immediately
  • Location: Remote
  • The Role: Gatsby is looking for a marketing generalist who can manage marketing operations, plan events, and write copy. This is a hybrid role that requires knowledge about general marketing best practices and flexibility to jump in and help out as needed. This person should be flexible and enjoy working on a small and agile team. Work will include creating scalable processes that ensure best practices in lead generation and database management. You will also conduct data analyses that will be used to inform strategic decisions by stakeholders from across the company. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects at once. Some event planning and content writing is required. You should know the principles of lead management and nurturing. Hubspot and Salesforce knowledge is a plus.

Why we’re hiring

Gatsby is growing fast, and we’re building out the marketing team to support this growth. We need an agile marketing manager to join a small team that will embrace the sometimes chaotic and fast paced nature of a startup.

What you’ll do on a day-to-day basis:

  • Marketing Automation Manage and build landing pages, lead capture forms, lists, and workflows in Hubspot. Salesforce knowledge is a plus.
  • Event planning Organize events including sourcing venues, managing sponsorships, promoting, and capturing leads.
  • Campaign Management Manage various campaigns to increase lead generation such as events, webinars, etc. Support these campaigns with landing pages, follow up emails, management of registration lists, etc.
  • Scalable processes Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in campaign and lead management.
  • Reporting Create and maintain metrics reports in Salesforce on marketing activities, effectiveness, and business impact. Analyze marketing and sales data to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization.
  • Data Quality Monitor and maintain data quality within the marketing database.
  • Marketing Systems Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems (marketing automation, CRM) used to generate, distribute, and report on leads.

Requirements:

  • Ideal candidate has experience working at a technology company and is familiar with website development tools
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with reporting and data analysis
  • Proficiency in marketing automation systems
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment
  • Technically capable, excellent communicator, and a desire to improve processes
  • Experience working with a Content Management System (Contentful) is a plus but not required

The best parts of this job

  • You’ll be at the cutting edge of website development — working at one of the fastest-growing website building frameworks on the market, learning about Gatsby’s innovative build system and modern tools such as Node, React, and GraphQL.
  • You’ll be part of a high-performing team at a VC-backed startup. The potential for growth and development is great.
  • You’ll get the chance to build something from the ground up. You set the priorities and determine the best way forward (with input from the team).
  • You’ll be working in a safe, open environment of talented marketers, engineers, and project managers who have a broad range of experience.

The worst parts of this job

  • We are still learning how to manage processes at scale, so things are a bit chaotic at times. We don’t have all our systems written down yet.
  • Startups like Gatsby are fast-paced and high energy which means we move quickly and adjust often. That might feel overwhelming at times.
  • You will likely have to chase someone down to get answers on occasion.
  • Because we’re all remote, it can be challenging to stay connected to the team.
Apply for job

items.content:
Content Marketing Editor at Animalz

Remote | International
  • Remote Worldwide
  • Full-Time

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies grow by producing high-quality, strategic content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the B2B SaaS/tech field.

We are looking for an editor who specializes in online content and who can help our writers improve over time and across clients in structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO. As much teacher as teammate, this person will review every piece of content at least twice — from the outlining phase to the nearly final draft — and use each review as an opportunity to encourage the writer and drive their continued growth in the craft.

“A real editor isn’t just someone you work with; they are your guide. They see your brain doing its thing and learn its weaknesses and abilities, and if they’re really good, they figure out what you need to hear to compensate for the former and accentuate the latter.” – Ariel Levy

An ideal B2B tech/SaaS content editor at Animalz:

  • has a proven track record of successful writing and editing for the web, particularly in B2B/tech/SaaS
  • can communicate why changes should be made, not simply fix errors or improve writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves coaching writers
  • understands the business side of writing & editing
  • is deeply passionate about good content and approaches editing with a creatively curious mindset
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future

Requirements:

  • Proven writing and editing ability
  • Mastery of on-page SEO and how to apply it to each piece of content to provide guidance for writers
  • Ability to understand content strategy and edit content to align with it
  • Desire to help writers improve their craft and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Experience successfully working with writing/editing customers
  • Basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each
  • Strong interest in the tech/SaaS field and a thorough knowledge of the top content and thought leadership in the field
  • Work in North America’s Eastern time zone to support our writers there and in Europe

Responsibilities:

  • Edit ~15 B2B articles and outlines per week (~1,500 words each), ensuring they comply with the customer strategy and optimizing them for performance
  • Educate our writers around good content in both form/structure and technical aspects (like SEO)
  • Provide support and constructive feedback to writers to help them improve their craft

About Animalz

We’re a remote, eclectic team of current and former scientists, journalists, operations folks with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the position

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote job. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is not a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors.

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like (during EST business hours)
  • Company-sponsored health insurance covering 80% of premium for medical and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year (including holidays)
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy a lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and conferences
Apply for job

Amazon Product Expert at Mobile Nations

Remote | Entry-level | Freelance

Austin, Texas, United States

Contract

Allows remote

Mobile Nations is looking for someone who lives and breathes Alexa, who has a Fire TV plugged in to every TV, and who can’t leave the house without grabbing their Kindle. We need an Amazon pro to join our team, and share their knowledge with our readers!

What kind of work is this?
We’re looking for someone who knows everything there is to know about the Amazon product library.

This includes:

  • Alexa Platform (via Echo and third party)
  • Alexa Ecosystem (connected home, and how it works)
  • Fire TV, Stick, and Recast
  • Fire Tablet
  • Kindle

As our Amazon Product Expert, your job will be to talk about every product Amazon makes, and everything that integrates into the Alexa ecosystem. You will be our Go-To person for all things Amazon.

Specifically, we need you to:

  • Explain how to use the best Alexa features
  • Demonstrate how connected home tech integrates into the Alexa Ecosystem and how it improves your life
  • Compare Alexa services and hardware to the competition

Is this assignment for me?

  • This position is designed for someone who is eager to write a lot about the Amazon ecosystem. This is a large product list with even more unique features, and we want to talk about all of it with our audience. This includes the occasional review, but most of this writing has to do with explaining individual features and helping out audience determine if those things are worth it for them to invest in Amazon over other connected home ecosystems.
  • This position is supported by the entire Mobile Nations staff. Alexa content lives on all of our websites right now, so you’ll be working with folks from Android Central, Windows Central, iMore, and CordCutters to create the best list of things our audeince needs to know. It’s not a requirement for you to own every Amazon product right now, either, just be very familiar with the ecosystem and ready to learn as much as you can while you work with our teams.

How much work is available?

We’re looking for someone willing to contribute long term, covering a wide assortment of products and accessories and discussing how they interact over time. This will include creating new content and maintaning it over time so it remains relevant to our audience. While there is no upper threshold on how many articles can be submitted, we do ask applicants commit to a minimum of four articles submitted per week for this particular assignment.

Are you ready? Come work with us!

SEO & Content Marketing Manager

At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a passionate and results-driven content marketing manager to grow our organic search traffic. The market is huge and the question is -- are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

Well, here’s what you’ll be doing

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. And will be the team expert.
You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣ produce content yourself, 2️⃣manage 10+ content writers to drive organic acquisition, 3️⃣ ensure team members follow best practises and 4️⃣ monitor and improve content quality. 
✈️ You’ll be equally responsible for content management and content production.
♂️ You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these

You’ve scaled to 1M+ views per month with content marketing.
♀️You’ve managed a team of freelancers, writers, or content researchers.
You love to write about things you don’t know the first thing about and can produce content about it in a day or two instead of a week.
Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. You read between the lines (mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this).
♂️You love content and know the difference between good and bad. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right.

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

How to join us

1️⃣ Apply and fill out the short form. 2️⃣ We'll review your application and invite you for an online interview to get to know you better. 3️⃣ If we like each other an assignment follows. 4️⃣ Finally, we'll make an offer if we feel you are the best fit for the position.

items.content:
Product Designer

Yoohoo. Biteable here. We’re on the lookout for a Product Designer to help us make the world’s simplest video maker even better. With millions of users, and millions more to come, we need someone that knows how to design products worth falling in love with. That’s you, right? 

All about you

You’re customer-centric.  You’re big on customer research and user experience. And you champion the user’s needs wherever you go.

Design is in your DNA.  UX and interaction design are your bag. You understand iterative processes like design thinking. And you can feel it in your tum-tum when the pixels sit just right.

You’re an architect. You’re skilled in information architecture design which means your designs are not only beautiful, but purposeful too.

You understand people. You’re collaborative, inclusive and empathetic. You’re calm and confident when challenges arise. And you've got a sense of humor that you share generously.

You do data. You’re nifty with data analytics and metrics. You don’t wear a white coat, but you’re comfortable designing and analyzing experiments.

You listen. You’re open to new ideas and you share your own openly. You involve others in ideation and you like criticism as much as praise.

You think critically. You ask ‘why’ often and you like to dive deep on problems and solutions. You don’t take things at face value. Except for this job ad.

All about the role

You’ll be joining an established design chapter and you’ll be working with autonomous teams.

We imagine you’ll do stuff like on this list. You’ll decide your actual tasks in collaboration with those around you.

  • Interface and UX design all the way through from ideation to release

  • User interviews and surveys to understand pleasure and pain points

  • Persuade and influence product direction

  • Lead workshops and showcases to encourage collaboration

  • Involve functional teams (like engineering, marketing, and product) in the design process

  • Use systems to improve effectiveness and efficiency

  • Move some pixels about 11 places to the left and 3 up

All about us

We are Biteable, a tech start-up that makes (jaw-dropping) videos possible for everyone. We stand apart in our market thanks to our dedication to studio-quality content and our passion for simplicity.

Since our launch in 2014 we’ve:

  • Created a community of over 4.6 million users

  • Rendered 9.6 million videos

  • Raised $3.9 million in venture capital

We’re growing fast and have offices in Melbourne and Hobart, Australia, with remote team members scattered around the world. We’re informal, structurally flat and fun to work with.

All about our culture

We believe in giving everyone a fair go. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We like it when everyone feels supported and free to create.

Our team members genuinely care about each other and define themselves as rigorous, respectful, open, supportive, honest, and egoless. Here are a few quotes that we didn’t make up:

“Biteable's team of smart, funny, engaged and caring people makes my work here enjoyable, every day. Being close to decisions and decision-makers helps me make an impact on our work.”

“The development team is a great group of people. They’re smart and interested in doing high-quality work, but foster a social and supportive atmosphere, too.”

“I’m thankful for the flexibility Biteable gives me around my family commitments. I really like that my team is open to new ideas and processes. And I enjoy that I get to work on a variety of problems with a mix of people with diverse areas of expertise.”

How to apply

We want you to start soon, so our application process is quick. To apply, send us your CV and a short cover letter about why you and Biteable fit together like the Eameses and Herman Miller.

We’ll review it and get back to you quick smart. We’ll then do two rounds of informal interviews. If it feels right for all of us, you’ll be on board faster than you can say ‘intuitive interface’.

Content Marketing Editor

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies grow by producing high-quality, strategic content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the B2B SaaS/tech field.

We are looking for an editor who specializes in online content and who can help our writers improve over time and across clients in structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO. As much teacher as teammate, this person will review every piece of content at least twice — from the outlining phase to the nearly final draft — and use each review as an opportunity to encourage the writer and drive their continued growth in the craft.

"A real editor isn’t just someone you work with; they are your guide. They see your brain doing its thing and learn its weaknesses and abilities, and if they're really good, they figure out what you need to hear to compensate for the former and accentuate the latter.” - Ariel Levy

An ideal B2B tech/SaaS content editor at Animalz:

  • has a proven track record of successful writing and editing for the web, particularly in B2B/tech/SaaS
  • can communicate why changes should be made, not simply fix errors or improve writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves coaching writers
  • understands the business side of writing & editing
  • is deeply passionate about good content and approaches editing with a creatively curious mindset
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future
Requirements:
  • Proven writing and editing ability
  • Mastery of on-page SEO and how to apply it to each piece of content to provide guidance for writers
  • Ability to understand content strategy and edit content to align with it
  • Desire to help writers improve their craft and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Experience successfully working with writing/editing customers
  • Basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each
  • Strong interest in the tech/SaaS field and a thorough knowledge of the top content and thought leadership in the field
  • Work in North America’s Eastern time zone to support our writers there and in Europe
Responsibilities:

  • Edit ~15 B2B articles and outlines per week (~1,500 words each), ensuring they comply with the customer strategy and optimizing them for performance
  • Educate our writers around good content in both form/structure and technical aspects (like SEO)
