items.title: Marketing Automation Specialist
items.content:
Marketing Automation Specialist at Blanket

Remote | International

What your day will look like

You’ll be working closely with me (Head of Operations), Anthony (PM), and our engineering team to debug, test, and implement new internal features.

Things you might do on any given Tuesday at Blanket:

  • Implement and maintain our operational stack (e.g. Periscope, HubSpot, Salesforce, Customer.io, Segment, Zapier, and more) and other relevant integrations between them.
  • Research, select, implement and integrate new best-of-breed tools covering different areas.
  • Set up and maintain reliable tracking throughout the lead lifecycle.
  • Build, enrich and maintain a highly accurate lead database and manage the processes and tools integrated to it.
  • Provide reliable dashboards and reports to track sales qualified leads performance as they move through the funnel
  • Design and measure segmented nurturing journeys and scoring workflows.

In short: manage marketing stack, database, and analytics.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of working with a data-informed Sales, Growth or Marketing team

There are other requirements that I could list here, but the reality is that they’ll differ depending on your specific background (Growth, Sales, Marketing). We expect you to lean into your strong suits and effectively communicate what skills you lack as you simultaneously get better at them.

Please point out what you consider your strengths are and why you think they’re required for this position when you reach out.

Preferred

  • Experience working remotely
  • Experience setting up integrations with Zapier
  • Experience in working with Segment and data visualization tools like Periscope
  • Experience setting up tracking and attribution for a B2B company

What we value

We’re building a teammate centric and remote-first company that recruits the best talent regardless of location, background, or gender.

We consider our work to be our craft. We’re driven by progress, getting a little bit better at what we do every single day. We value working openly and transparently because it helps maintain and scale our culture.

The best way to feel what we value is to check out culture guide.

We’re likely not a good fit if you

  • Seek comfort
  • Feel best around teams with a clear hierarchy
  • Find that teams work best when people stick to their job descriptions (“I probably shouldn’t do that, that’s not my job”)
  • Think hustle and hard work are overrated
  • Feel that you’re at a skill level that you’re complacent with
  • Think that remote teams don’t work as well as having everyone in the same office
  • Are any combination of ninja, rockstar, or guru
  • Enjoy big-reveal moments after working siloed on a project

Consider joining if you

  • Value a teammate approach to company building
  • Enjoy working in flat-ish hierarchies
  • Think that there’s still a ton for you to learn
  • Believe in openly sharing progress as you work
  • Believe in giving and receiving candid and transparent feedback
  • Are capable of having robust debates
  • Embrace a Disagree and commit culture, because it leads to better products than consensus-driven ones
  • Are an entrepreneur at heart
  • Believe in being deliberate about how you spend time
  • Are high on self-awareness and introspectiveness

Perks and benefits

Our four biggest perks and benefits:

  • Work environment freedom and flexibility
  • Everything you do or say matters
  • Everything you do or say has a tangible impact
  • Results are valued over egos on all interactions

Since we believe those benefits are vital to long-term sustainable happiness, it means that our monetary and lifestyle benefits will always use them as a Northstar:

  • Work wherever you want
  • We cover 90% of your health insurance premium
  • We cover 75% of your dental and vision insurance premiums
  • Workspace stipend (up to $500 a month)
  • Book stipend (up to $30 a month)
  • Learning and development credit per year to invest in your craft
  • Three paid weeks and five paid holidays per year
  • 12 weeks of paid family leave (for primary and secondary caregivers)

Osvaldo Ruiz 1 1

Job description

Overview

With over 10,000 online merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge we're processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week. Our mission ‘to make repeat orders easier' began four years ago as a bootstrapped startup and today we're at the forefront of recurring billing software with over 100 remote-first employees around the globe.

As Product Manager you’ll be responsible for making product decisions and executing on delivering world-class e-commerce features. You’ll work closely with our Store and Shopper teams to help our store owners bring valuable features to market for their customers.

We’re looking for someone who loves being in the details and solving highly technical complex problems. The ReCharge platform is growing quickly and we need a creative and resourceful integrator who will actively listen for problems and then accelerate the team towards solving.

Our stack includes: Python, Flask, Vue.js, Snowflake, Matillion

What You’ll Do

  • Live by and champion our values: #ownership, #empathy, #simple-solutions.
  • Understand our customer’s business goals and deliver features to help them grow.
  • Deliver solutions for complex multivariable problems - that our customers will love.
  • Investigate and create the feature product roadmap and design-build-adoption lifecycle.
  • Define detailed product requirements and enhancements for short and long-term releases.
  • Identify and define core issues that customers face, conduct user research and own features across the entire lifecycle through deployment.
  • Drive initiatives through to completion, providing detailed progress metrics during build and thorough, insightful analysis of results post-launch.
  • Collaborate with design and engineering teams across the company to build new features or update existing ones at scale.
  • Figure out ways to get products into the hands of customers to get feedback quickly.

What You’ll Bring

  • Typically, 4+ years of product management experience for a software product, B2B, B2B2C, or B2C SaaS platform preferred
  • 4+ years of experience as a product owner on agile development teams
  • Demonstrated ability to turn high level ideas and requirements into technical specifications 
  • Experience working with software engineering teams; deep commitment to customers and team collaboration
  • Entrepreneurial, start-up mindset, "Roll-up-your-sleeves" attitude
  • Experience owning and delivering high-impact software products 
  • Ability to understand, evaluate and discuss technical areas, proficient with SQL queries
  • Strategic mindset with the ability to plan for the future while focusing on execution today
  • Strong analysis, process, problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact at a boot-strapped start-up
  • Exceptional communication skills with customers, colleagues, and executives
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience desired 

ReCharge Payments is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. ReCharge Payments prohibits any form of workplace harassment. 

Apply now

About ReCharge Payments

About Us

In 2015, we built ReCharge to make payments easy for everyone. By constantly finding solutions for customers to reorder products, we are now able to help over 15,000 business dramatically grow and thrive. We have two missions at ReCharge: make it easy for people to sell subscription products online, and create an amazing remote-first culture.

The first mission began as three people working out of a small apartment, trying to solve one of the biggest problems facing Shopify merchants: recurring payments. Now we’re at the forefront of recurring billing software, empowering thousands of entrepreneurs to sell their products as subscriptions, and processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week.

Our culture is remote-first and we stay connected every day using Slack and video chat. Being part of a small, fast-growing company is exciting. The opportunities to grow and take ownership at ReCharge are endless and we’ll make sure you have everything you need to do your best work and make a big impact.

How We Work

The best people are everywhere, not just in the radius around our headquarters in Santa Monica, California. Work is an action, not a place at ReCharge and that’s why we've expanded our horizons from the Andes in Argentina to the Rockies in Denver, Colorado. By expanding our reach to build remote-first teams we've been able to uncover outstanding talent around the globe and are rapidly approaching 100 employees.

The ReCharge team maintains a work-life balance approach. We understand that hobbies exist and encourage our employees to pursue them. After joining you'll quickly find you have teammates that surf, sail, cycle, read (hardcovers!), tour the country in bands and festival hop - all while doing great work and exceeding expectations. Above all, we realize if you empower people to pursue their passions, they will help change the world.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation, health benefits, 401K
  • Unlimited paid time off (PTO) to pursue your passions
  • Team retreats - bi-annual retreats to share our successes together
  • Monthly ReCharge subscription
  • Equipment - we provide equipment of your choice

About us...
Sierra Interactive is a small (but growing!) tech company based out of Louisville with an expanding remote team. When we launched our first SaaS product a few years ago, we had no idea how much pent up demand there was. We hit the ground running and continue to experience strong growth (we’ve more than doubled our user base in the past year). Now, we need to expand our team to meet the needs of our users… and that’s where you come in.

About this role...
As the Product Designer, you'll be responsible for designing new product features and evolving the design culture at Sierra. On a day-to-day basis, you'll work closely with our product managers, designers (freelancers) and developers to build solutions that empower realtors to close more deals. Our entire product team is 100% remote and distributed across multiple time zones. You’ll need to be comfortable designing in this environment.

Day-to-day you will…
  • Act as the design lead on the product team, handling all aspects of design for product enhancements
  • Work with the product management team to design simple, easy to use solutions for our clients
  • Manage multiple design projects at one time -- all in various stages, requiring differing levels of efforts
  • Communicate, explain, persuade, explore and otherwise get a lot of the things done in writing. (Yes, we meet with each other regularly, but as a remote team across many time zones, a lot of our collaboration is asynchronous and written.)

We’re looking for a designer with...
  • 5+ years of experience designing software products (preferably in a SaaS environment)
  • A portfolio showcasing your skills in interaction and visual design for software products
  • Websites and graphic design is fine but we’re really looking for case studies of digital product experience (e.g., web apps, iOS apps, wordpress plugins, etc.), especially adding features to existing products
  • Extra bonus points if you have examples of projects you designed we can actually use
  • Advanced knowledge of UI design software (e.g., Sketch, Invision, Adobe CC/Xd, Figma, etc)
  • A desire to be part of a product team iterating and improving on the product day-to-day
  • A strong opinion on design but the humility to seek and incorporate feedback
  • A highly collaborative nature and willingness for showing in progress design work
  • The ability to clearly communicate design rationale and conceptual ideas to a wide variety of people
  • BA/BS degree in a related discipline (e.g., design, human-computer interaction, visual communication, etc.) or equivalent work experience

Extra bonus points if...
  • You have a good understanding of front-end web development (HTML/CSS) … you won’t be coding but we believe it’s good to know the intricacies and limitations of the medium you’re designing for
  • You have experience working with a web-based CRM
  • You have experience working with real estate technology
  • You have experience working remotely
  • You have experience working with a distributed development team
  • You have experience working in an agile environment
  • You have experience working at a startup

Benefits
  • 100% remote work (if you’re in Louisville, we’ll gladly setup a desk for you)
  • Competitive compensation (depends on experience, of course)
  • Health/vision/dental insurance
  • Retirement plan (Simple IRA) with employer matching contributions
  • Paid holidays and paid time off
  • A respectful and open work environment

About The Cooperative Development Institute (CDI): The Cooperative Development Institute (CDI, www.cdi.coop) is the Northeast’s Center for cooperative business education, training, and technical assistance. CDI was founded in 1994 by cooperative leaders across industry sectors to build a cooperative economy in the Northeast. Our mission is to work with people in the Northeast to create cooperative businesses and networks that grow a prosperous, equitable economy. We envision a democratically-owned and just economy where everyone can fulfill their needs and aspirations. CDI works to support, advise and provide technical assistance to all sorts of cooperatives in the Northeast. CDI’s New England Resident Owned Communities (NEROC) program provides support and assistance for residents of manufactured home communities to purchase their parks and run them cooperatively. Our Business Ownership Solutions (BOS) program focuses on conversion of existing businesses to worker ownership and our Cooperative Food Systems (CFS) program works with all food-related cooperatives; from assisting New American and Native American farmers to rural food cooperative retail stores and producer co-ops. And that’s not all of what we do!

CDI is a virtually based 501(c)3 non-profit that has 20 employees. CDI employees enjoy their jobs and appreciate the flexibility of working from home, the commitment to continuous learning, and how interesting and varied our work is. Because our organization is transparent, accountable, and participatory, our staff’s ideas and opinions count. We are committed to maintaining this as a priority.

Position Overview:

The Cooperative Development Institute is looking for a half-time Communications & Development Associate to provide support to CDI’s communications & development teams. Editing and writing organizational materials, assisting with social media production, grant preparation, and individual donor solicitation will be important parts of the job, as CDI seeks to achieve the organization’s communications and fundraising goals. The successful candidate is an excellent communicator with strong attention to detail. Social media marketing experience and a background in membership development are great attributes. Ultimately, the goal of this position will be to help ensure effective clear communication of our organization’s message across all channels in support of both communications and development priorities. This position reports to the Director of Development & Communications.

Communications Responsibilities

  • Provide administrative support to CDI’s Communications team including the scheduling of meetings and agenda preparation
  • Draft and edit communications copy (e.g. press releases, newsletter articles, social media posts, other publications)
  • Assist in maintaining web content and executing social media strategies
  • Update databases and media lists
  • Track projects and media exposure
  • Facilitate effective internal communications to advance the goals of the Communications and Development programs in a team environment
  • Maintain calendars and appointments
  • Prepare presentations and reports
  • Provide assistance to the Communication Team in implementing communications projects and strategies

Communications Requirements

  • Proven experience as a Communications Associate, Communications Specialist or similar role
  • Understanding of media relations and digital media strategies
  • Solid writing, editing and researching skills
  • Excellent communication abilities (oral and written)
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong organizational skills and task management
  • Proficient in MS Office and Google Apps
  • Familiarity with web platform management, experience with WordPress a plus
  • Familiarity with social media platform management including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Hoot Suite
  • Familiarity with design software (e.g. Photoshop, InDesign) and content management systems is a plus
  • Experience with Salesforce a plus
  • Experience with Meltwater a plus

Development Responsibilities

  • Assist the Director of Development & Communications in prospecting foundations for appropriate grant applications
  • Assist the Development Team in the preparation of grant submissions, including content drafting and the preparation of supporting materials
  • Assist the Development team in implementing the organization’s major donor and grassroots fundraising efforts
  • Assist in database management to develop and maintain donor contact list, and contribute to solicitation efforts.

Development Requirements

  • Prior experience with foundation prospecting preferred
  • Some experience with grant writing and proposal preparation preferred
  • Experience in digital and social media platform solicitation a plus
  • Prior experience with individual donor solicitation also a plus
  • Experience with Salesforce preferred

Inclusion: In accordance with Federal law, this institution is prohibited from discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability. CDI is an equal opportunity employer and service provider. We promote economic prosperity for all through our work with our clients, our hiring practices, and our vigorous commitment to cooperative principles. We strive daily to acknowledge and eliminate all forms of oppression. By examining bias within ourselves and our organization, we work mindfully to make our board and staff more inclusive. We actively fight against racism, 3 classism, gender inequality and all efforts to marginalize anyone. The nature of our work engages us directly with the working poor, the educationally disadvantaged, the elderly, immigrants and refugees. It is our goal to see all of our clients prosper within the cooperative movement. We welcome applicants from underrepresented identities, and those who have a commitment and track record of bringing an inclusive and equitable approach to their work.

items.content:
Product Designer at Interview Schedule

Remote | International
  • Product Engineering
  • Remote

The Opportunity

Interview Schedule is changing how teams hire. Our first product streamlines recruiting scheduling and coordination, saving teams hundreds of hours a month. We’re just getting started on, and have our sights set on making hiring a great experience for recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates. We’re building the platform to engage these key stakeholders and fix the $200 billion per year hiring industry.

This is an exceptional opportunity to join a small and fast-growing startup, transforming an industry with powerful and easy to use products customers love. As an early employee you’ll have tons of ownership, a big impact on product, a say in our values, and opportunities to tremendously accelerate your career growth.

We’re building a remote team and looking for the best individuals – no matter where you are. All we require is a reliable internet connection and passion for building an amazing company.

What We’re Looking For

You’re a product designer with a passion for elegant UI / UX. You believe design is more than pixel pushing – it’s a process to create useful, usable, and beautiful products. You have an intuition for elegant designs, but recognize there’s no replacement for user testing. You’re incredibly empathetic and want to build something people want. You may have explored product management and recognize that choosing the right problem to solve is as valuable as designing solutions.

Building products through the entire design life cycle is where you shine. You’d consider yourself a full stack generalist, comfortable with everything from research to high fidelity mockups. That includes user experience, user interface, interactions, information architecture, sketches, and wireframes. You’ve worked with and know how to be part of an engineering team. Your design process is pragmatic and actionable, helping accelerate development. Building and using a consistent design system excites you.

As the sole designer on the team, you can also handle graphic design tasks as they arise. That includes branding, helping with marketing materials, and polishing external documents.

What You’ll Do
You’ll be embedded with engineering and work closely with the founders to create delightful products. Starting from a problem our customers face, you’ll work with engineers to design a solution. This will be an iterative process of talking to customers, wire-framing, and working with engineers. As the solution becomes better defined, you’ll provide engineers high fidelity UI mockups.

In addition to day to day feature development, you’ll play an integral part in defining the product direction and strategy, helping create a cohesive product experience. You’ll also own the UI and brand visual direction.

What We Value

At Interview Schedule we believe in ownership and accountability, challenging the status quo, nothing is “not my job”, having empathy, being direct, and being honest.

What We Offer

  • Autonomy, impact, and ownership. As an early employee you’ll shape the product direction and company values.
  • Competitive salary and significant equity in a fast growing, early stage startup.
  • Remote employment – work where you want, when you want.
  • Generous vacation policy – take time whenever you need to recharge. Building a lasting company is a marathon, not a sprint.
  • Top-notch healthcare, dental, and vision coverage.
  • Life and disability insurance.
  • Annual company retreat – helps build camaraderie as a remote team.
  • Computer and home office setup – we’ll buy anything you need to do your best work.
  • Continuing education allowance – learn what you want, when you want.

items.content:
*About us*
GoCardless’ vision is to build a global connected payments network, making payments simpler on the internet no matter what country you’re in or what software you’re using.

Today, we help over 40,000 businesses across the UK, Europe, Australia/New Zealand and North America collect payments, and we’re growing fast. Last year we opened an office in France, Australia and Germany. We work with a huge range of organisations: small gyms and scout groups use us to reduce admin; fast growing companies like Funding Circle use us to power their growth; established institutions like The Guardian, Doctolib, La Fourchette, Sowee use us to dramatically reduce failure rates.

Our strategic partnerships with best-in-class billing platforms such as Zuora, Salesforce and Chargebee have been critical to our success in reaching over 40,000 business and will be key to our future success both locally and globally.

We’re London-based and backed by some of the world’s leading investors including Google Ventures, Salesforce Ventures, Balderton Capital, Accel Partners and Notion Capital.



*The French team*
France being the largest market outside of the UK for GoCardless, the company has ambitious plans to scale up in 2019. We expect to grow through a combination of existing relationships with global and local partners (e.g., Zuora, Salesforce, iRaiser) and merchants and dedicated Sales and Marketing resource focused on building demand in the country.

Our office in Paris is located near Gare St. Lazare, Rue de Londres. We have a team of 15 sales, partnerships, marketing and customer success people. The team is only growing as we scale up.



*Your role*
This is a senior individual contributor role. This role is ideal for a growth-minded marketer looking to work on the French marketer for a rapidly growing London HQ-ed fintech company.

As the French Marketing Manager, you will work closely with our France General Manager and the International Marketing lead to scale our business in France. You will be responsible for identifying the most attractive pockets of opportunity in the market to develop the right Marketing approaches to unlock them. To do this, you will need to work closely with our local Sales and Partnerships teams and with a range of Marketing teams in our London HQ (including Digital, Marketing Operations, Content Marketing and more).

You will own the Go-To-Market Marketing plan and budget for France and be responsible for setting our milestones and tracking performance against company KPIs. Your day-to-day role will vary, encompassing a wide range of activities across a number of different channels.

The sort of projects that we’d expect you to be involved with include: planning and executing the GTM marketing vision for France; growing awareness for GoCardless in France via PR, Events and thought leadership and local influencers; identifying data-driven strategies to scale leads and opportunities for France; working closely with the central marketing team to deliver content, campaigns, digital and email marketing for France.


*Your responsibilities*
* Drive the local France go to market marketing strategy, plan and execution
* Understand the local competitive landscape
* Identify/develop innovative program metrics/benchmarks
* Align with Sales and Marketing teams as needed to plan and execute near-term go-to-market (GTM) plans
* Work with internal stakeholders locally and centrally across our Sales, Marketing and Partnership teams and, where needed, external providers to deliver these plans
* Track, measure and report progress for marketing activities against KPIs
* Problem solving mindsets to troubleshoot roadblocks


*Your experience*
* Highly motivated ‘self-starter’ with entrepreneurial spirit that likes to both strategise & execute
* Well rounded B2B, Enterprise and/or SaaS related marketing experience (ideally tech-enabled), with broad knowledge across growth channels, events and content development
* Proven record of high performance in your previous positions
* Define and deliver Marketing budgets and plans
* Performance and data driven marketer
* Develop and manage campaigns
* Proven track record for enabling Sales & Marketing alignment around processes, funnel and more
* Comfortable with CRM, Marketing Automation systems and measurement tools (e.g. Salesforce, Pardot, Google Analytics, Looker, Tableau)
* Experience working with third party vendors, agencies and freelancers
* Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to interact with virtual teams
* Fluent in French and English

*Ideal but not essential*
Previous experience working within the payments industry
Account-based marketing experience would be a plus


_We welcome a wide diversity of applicants, and our team are from a variety of backgrounds, so if you’re unsure please apply._

By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

What you’ll do:

  • Create high quality design solutions from concept to production – from concept to wireframe, to mockup/prototype, to production
  • Design user flows, interaction, and pixels to turn complex data and content into simple and intuitive experiences
  • Work closely with development team to ensure technical feasibility of design
  • Confidently communicate daily with clients to understand and deliver requirements
  • Manage your own workflow to meet the deadlines which you will have set with your team to ensure success

What is Required:

  • 5 years experience developing digital products across a variety of mediums, including web and mobile
  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Product Design, or related design field (or applicable experience)

  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work


Getting Hired
We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations

SEO Strategist at Sked Social

Remote | Freelance | International

Marketing

Contract

Remote

We are a B2B software as a service tool that helps people schedule content on social media.

We are looking for someone to lead our more specialised SEO efforts internally, on a full or part time (at least 2 days a week) basis, with an initial 3 month contract.

What we’re looking for

  • We are looking for someone who:
  • Lives their day inside Ahrefs/SEMrush/Clearscope etc
  • Loves to take a very technical and metricsfocussed approach to SEO
  • Wants to take on a challenge, with competitive keywords
  • Can lead the efforts internally from strategy to execution.
  • Has experience in the B2B SaaS space, ideally in a marketing focussed tool.
  • We would like to find someone who is willing to get their hands dirty and can manage the SEO process endtoend so that you can keep the feedback loops fast.
  • When/if you run out of time to DIY, we can talk about adding extra people or contractors to be able to free up your time, but for us it’s important that you aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty and that you have recent experience “doing the work”, not just setting strategy.
  • You will need to have at least 23 hours overlap in working hours (8am6pm) of Melbourne, Australia time, but otherwise our team is fully remote distributed around the world.

What you’ll work on

  • Your first 12 weeks will be focused on auditing our existing activities and identifying what the quick wins might be for the best keywords to generate revenue.
  • Then you’ll work on implementing your thoughts alongside our team, with a focus on a keyword list of 1020 high quality and high intent keywords you have researched that you think will create the best ROI for us.
  • You’ll regularly report on progress as we climb up the SERPs, and likely contribute to various other campaigns and projects our team works on.

Salary guide

We’re pricing this role at US$55-60k per annum (prorata if you work part time) – we also have a profit share program, paid time off and more.

Integration Partner Manager

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 15,000 businesses. Our mission is to make ecommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.
TaxJar’s remote-only team of 90+ people is growing fast. We’re currently looking for an Integration Partner Manager who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs.

*This is a full-time remote position based in the US only.

REQUIREMENTS

As an Integration Partner Manager you will

  • Coordinate and manage the implementation and onboarding of integration partners
  • Act as liaison between integration partners and TaxJar’s platform integrations team, managing integration review and certification process
  • First level escalation contact for integration partners and internal departments with questions related to integrations
  • Support analysis/business reviews for partner optimization and yield improvement
  • Develop ad hoc reporting as needed per internal and external requests
  • Collaborate directly with our partnership team to identify, streamline, and support all go-to-market initiatives to develop and execute a revenue generating partnership based off partner tier and scope we see for each integration partner
  • Automate partner tiering process with TaxJar’s partner portal with access to joint content, sales enablement tools, joint campaign material, and onboarding activities for our partners
  • Lead partner marketing activities to meet quota attainment and strategic company objectives. Collaborate with sales to review sales metrics for partnership QBR’s and tiering assessments
  • Evaluate the ROI of partner marketing activities and recommend actions to improve lead generation and quality to drive leads to opportunities
  • Creation and updating of messaging for solutions tailored to fit each integration partner (integration options, market differentiations from competition, size of addressable markets, etc.)
  • Manage and track spending, lead generation, and ROI for the partner activities and campaign performance
  • Identify industry events to drive partner development through messaging and brand awareness (user groups, associations, industry meet-ups)
  • Create and/or seek opportunities to execute on joint webinars through integration partnerships to drive messaging through the channel
  • Collaborate with internal teams to best train our employees about our integration partnerships, messaging, product functionality, marketing assets available, and joint marketing activities
You have

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related field
  • Organizational and self-management ability – Must be able to independently manage several projects at once
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills; analytical background
  • Project management skills preferred to monitor projects and keep them on track
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
  • Must possess exceptional problem-solving, analytical, and research skills
  • Able to make independent choices and recommendations without immediate supervision
  • Travel and participation in events and after-hours meetings with partners as required
You’ll be a great fit for TaxJar if you

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable

We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit  www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

Marketing Manager – Enterprise Solutions Expansion/ABM

At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.

SUMMARY

Marketing managers focusing on account-based strategies, plan, organize, and execute programs that generate new business and advance existing opportunities within specific, targeted accounts. They create programs and engagement that help connect high-value customers to our brand.

Pearson is seeking a Marketing Manager to join our organization, specifically supporting our account-based management initiatives within Pearson’s North America Marketing organization. Combining audience and modern marketing disciplines, the focus of this role will be to partner with the sales and product teams to develop 1:1 and 1:few tactics designed to engage with targeted accounts. This role is critical in reaching the marketing pipeline goals set by Pearson, aligned to the sales revenue targets.

The ideal candidate should have a proven track record of creating marketing programs that can be delivered across digital/inbound and outbound channels to drive engagement. This position requires a high level of creativity and innovation, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights to create and optimize multi-touch marketing programs. A successful candidate will have a passion for taking the complex and making it simple and should be detail-oriented, agile, and committed to meeting tight deadlines.

  • Proactively engage with the sales and product teams to coordinate, communicate, and prioritize the impact of marketing activities

We are looking for an excellent performance marketeer who's a team player and can help us scale Paintgun.

items.content:
*Nimbla* provides a first of a kind invoice protection solution so that Britain’s SMEs continue to trade with confidence. We are building the future of small business protection, and are on high growth trajectory having just closed our first super seed round. A Barclays Techstars Alumni we have the backing from Munich RE, the world’s leading insurers’.

The Credit Risk Analyst will be someone who wants the freedom to build something different and help us keep the thriving small business enterprise alive. This is the opportunity to help shape the direction of one of the most promising FinTech startups in the UK. This is a commercial risk role where you will be expected to balance risk against the commercial ambitions of the business. We will count on you to make a significant contribution to our success and will support yours in the process.

*About You:*
You are a highly innovative Credit Risk specialist who will build on Nimbla’s Credit Risk function by driving change and improving our overall risk management and risk measurement and prediction.

Driven by a desire to learn as well as supporting a growing business, you are looking for the opportunity to use your understanding of credit risk and analytical skills to shape the vision and the future of the organisation. This is a commercial risk role where you will be expected to balance risk against the commercial ambitions of the business. You will understand traditional credit risk methods but have a passion to use data to bring credit risk forecasting and modelling to the next level. You are keen to help us improve our business practices, drive our growth and expand our portfolio. You will have the support of our data science team to enhance existing models and build new models to test and learn from. Together you will source new data and methods that are the foundation of our revenues.

With a passion for high-quality innovative businesses, you will be experienced in developing risk models, setting limits, testing hypothesis and monitoring the trends across our user base to identify how macro events impact our portfolio. You excel in an open environment where you have the flexibility to work in a way that suits you best.

*You will:*
* Develop and improve the current credit risk monitoring tools, including portfolio credit risk monitoring and credit stress testing
* Provide analysis and insight into the Credit Risk profile and maintaining robust reporting suite
* Build NPV models to inform insuring decisions and overall strategy, and understanding their limitations
* Report and escalate material risk events, including conduct risk events and conflicts of interest, or losses
* Use analytics to produce an insurance risk limit, manage our insurance risk strategy
* As a result of the above, advise on the best pricing structure for all our insurance products
* Ground the loss/default assumption to be used in acquisition or customer management decisions
* Change, remove and add insuring policy rules
* Generation of key management information to support business direction and ensure Risk Appetite objectives are met

*Your Experience:*
* Python, R, Scala, Java or Matlab in a data science context (Propensity models, segmentation or solving complex problems using optimisations techniques)
Ability to interpret complex data and apply numerical techniques is key, and familiarity with statistical methods is expected;
Conceptual thinking – ability to find innovative ways to solve analytical problems
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well within cross-functional teams

*Bonus Points For:*
* Previous Risk Analytics experience in a Financial Services Organization
Experience of working within a regulated industry
Experience or interest in Credit Risk Analysis

*What You’d Expect*
* A competitive salary
* Equity
* Full auto-enrollment workplace pension for all employees with 2% employer contribution.
* Bike to work scheme
* Tech purchase scheme
* Comfortable and trendy Rise London workspace, a stone’s throw from Silicon Roundabout
* Unlimited coffee, tea and fruit every day
* Holidays: we offer 28 days of holiday per annum, plus bank holidays off.

*Work-life balance*
* Autonomy and empowerment: What matters is that the job gets done and that we help each other in accomplishing our vision and goals. Once the goals are set, how you achieve results is up to you.
* Radical Candour: We all want to grow, and we help each other do so by maintaining candid, open conversations, especially when it's hard. Be kind, and be opened and honest
* Dynamic working hours: We trust you to establish an effective working pattern that allows you to excel in your role. This includes working from home, of course.
* Learning & Development: Books, courses, and £1,000 budget to spend as you wish for your personal development.
* Dogs in the office.
* Daily talks and meet-ups presented in the building by the Barclays Innovation team.

*At Nimbla We Believe In:*
* *Fairness:*
* For our customers: We aim to make Business a fairer place by protecting SMEs from bad debt.
* For our team: together, we create an environment in which everyone is comfortable developing within their roles and within the business.

* *Learning:*
Aim to learn something new every day, big or small to grow personally and bring about positive change

* *Creativity:*
We each strive to be creative, support innovation and wonderful experiences to our users

* *Measuring performance more than time:*
This position is being offered on a flexible work-week basis with no compromise on salary

* *Flexible working:*
We are based in the comfortable and trendy Rise London workspace, a stone’s throw from Silicon Roundabout. We will love to see you there, you will also have the opportunity to work remotely and balance your life and your work as works for you.

Company: Your Best Digs
Location: Telecommute
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Your Best Digs is a fun product testing and product review company and we're expanding! YourBestDigs.com is a subsidiary of Siege Media, a content marketing agency named one of the Fastest Growing Companies in San Diego in 2017, Inc 5000 Fastest Growing Companies in America and San Diego's Best Places to Work. We're looking to add a motivated, remote freelance writer to help write superb content solely for YourBestDigs.com.

Responsibilities:

  • Write 5,500-6,500 word in-depth reviews on specific types of home products after TESTING them. Categories will likely span small appliances, electronics, bed, bath, yard, etc.
  • Research and determine what makes a good product
    -Methodically and thoroughly test a group of products for all the features and details the average and not-so-average consumer would care about
  • You'll work from home, but will be responsible for shipping products to/from our headquarters in California.
  • Important: There will be rigid due dates to finish writing reviews. Do not apply if your schedule is too unpredictable.

The *perfect* candidate will:

  • Have experience writing product reviews or technical content, with a touch of personality
  • Have discerning tastes and strong attention to detail when it comes to using and buying products
  • Have effective communication skills
  • Be experienced with the internet, social media
  • Be able to quickly and accurately type, to write reviews and e-mails
  • Have excellent command of the English language, not requiring grammar edits
  • Have experience publishing web content on WordPress or similar CMSs
  • Be organized and have a superb attention to detail
  • Be familiar with webmail, gmail
  • Get along well with our team members. We're a relaxed, yet "get stuff done" type of group.

Bonus skills (not required):

  • Have photography or videography skills
  • Have an existing social presence to help distribute written reviews and also establish credibility as a reviewer

This is a freelance, telecommuting, contractor position, and we prefer that you're able to commit at least 15-20 hours a week to this as we can provide as much work as you can handle. We are looking for people who plan to have at least 6 months of availability on this project to make the training time worth it for both of us. Pay rate is DOE. We are looking to hire as soon as you're ready.

Reminder: There will be rigid due dates to finish writing reviews. Do not apply if your schedule is too unpredictable.

To apply: E-mail your CV, examples of writing you've done, a cover letter with 'Your Best ProBlogger' in the subject line, address why you would be a fit for each of the "responsibilities" section above, and why you'd want this position. Sales and Marketing Manager

United Kingdom, London
Company: - The Resourcing Hub

Overview

Sales and Marketing/Opportunity: Customer Acquisition Manager (Tourism Sector)

Global Digital Transformation Consultancy

Digital Transformation Programme – Government Dept.

Location: Remote and Some Travel – Infrequent

Salary: Up to £80,000 plus 20% bonus and Benefits.

It’s not often an opportunity like this comes knocking

Do you have experience in the tourism sector? Are you looking for your next challenge and make your mark in this industry?

The Opportunity:

We’re looking to complement a newly created delivery team with a Senior Customer Acquisition Management professional with experience of the tourism sector. The aim of the role will be to support a high-impact/high profile project for a widely known UK Government organisation, via a prestigious consultancy, by leveraging a newly developed product – a unique and exciting online digital marketplace’. This newly created role is the result of long-term contract being awarded to our client, and make no mistake, this opportunity will see you at the start of a revolution in this multi billion-pound industry!

We require those who can bring passion and expertise to a team of energetic, smart and capable delivery professionals, whilst supporting the consultancy in its mission to deliver business solutions and user-centred, digital transformation to this widely known end-client, across the tourism sector.

Our client’s product teams are small, multidisciplinary, often remote and focused on getting things done. Our client follows an agile approach but knows the difference between the dogma and what’s actually required to work together successfully! And here’s your opportunity to be a part of it

Interested?

Do you have what it takes?

You will experience a highly engaging environment and be the type of professional with a strong commitment to, and enjoys, providing pragmatic, sleeves-rolled-up delivery to your customer base. You will be passionate about the tourism sector and a strong advocate of technology, thus embracing the many possibilities technology can bring to your role and the end-customer. When you think that you’ve seen it all before, this role might just shatter that thought as you embark on a role that will see you making, not only your mark as a professional, but also widely contributing to raising the profile of UK Tourism to the global market.

We’re keen to speak to professionals with a background in and/or working within:

  • Organisations that supply tourism products to the market (ie accommodation, events, attractions and tours)
  • B2C vendors that buys products and sell to consumers or B2B vendors who buy products, provide packages who sell to other businesses who may choose to sell to other businesses or consumers in the value chain
  • IT vendors who provide management software’ to the market (ie reservation management systems, tour management systems, property management systems, channel management solutions)

What we’re looking for

With your tourism sector experience, which forms an essential component of the role, to succeed you will have:

  • A degree or possess the equivalent industry experience
  • Proven and demonstrable track record of customer acquisition and/or account management, developing long term customer partnerships
  • Experience in tourism product marketing and with some direct sales exposure
  • A proven track record in providing inspirational leadership and acting as a role model in all interactions and engagements.
  • Experience in successfully delivering strategic marketing and communications strategies, evaluating the performance of marketing and media agencies.
  • Experience of setting, monitoring and reviewing complex budgets with a strong focus on value for money and ROI.
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal.
  • Experience of working within multidisciplinary teams.
  • Well-adjusted to navigating ambiguity and challenging environments.
  • Possess the ability to manage and develop relationships with senior stakeholders within an organisation.

So, what‘s on offer?

Along with a generous salary and bonus package, you will also be a key and valued representative of an acclaimed Global Digital Transformation Consultancy working with a high-profile Government client. You’ll be working with some of industry’s most acclaimed professionals and have the chance to deploy the latest and most advanced technologies in the role…

Our Client really is different to most. It’s a place where you can make the hard things happen for clients, working alongside colleagues who value doing the right thing and not the easy thing. It’s a place where they trust in you to flourish. Because they know you value flexibility, they’ll leave it to you to decide where you wish to work – at home or onsite with clients – and you’ll be judged on outcomes and not location. Equally they value life-work balance as much as you do, focusing on output more than input.

This is a very real opportunity to make your mark in industry and advance your career too, so if this sounds like your next move, please contact us today with your up to date CV.

*BY SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION YOU AGREE TO THE RESOURCING HUB’S PRIVACY POLICY ON OUR WEBSITE AND YOUR DETAILS BEING ADDED TO OUR DATABASE.*

items.title: German Speaking eCommerce and Marketing Admin Assistant - Working With Start-ups
items.content:
We are a fast growing start-up that helps the most exciting brands launch in Europe. We cover and manage the entire end to end process from logistics, D2C sales and Amazon Europe management.

We work with crowd funded brands coming from the US that have raised millions of $ on Kickstarter and Indiegogo. Learn about start-up life, ecommerce, logistics and marketing.

We are looking for a German speaking admin and marketing assistant to support the team in the day to day running of the company. Roles range from forecasting and processing orders on Amazon - the world’s largest e-commerce, to owning relationships with influencers from all over Europe, to managing warehouse relationships - as broad as it sounds. Our largest growth area is in Germany at the moment so we're looking for someone to learn about retail and marketing and bring their own style to the team.

You will be given a lot of responsibility from day one. We are looking for someone with amazing attention to detail and great organisational skills.

Key Responsibilities:

Day to day management of Amazon with duties including:
Stock forecasting
Order processing and chasing
Building content and ensuring its kept up to date
Assistance with marketing services, learning about Amazon marketing. Building DE marketing campaigns.
Weekly sales reporting duties
Customer support
Managing Amazon seller support queries for UK/DE/FR/IT/ES

Warehouse/Logistics
Processing orders with our UK warehouse.
Owning relationship with warehouse to manage shipments
Managing returns processes with warehouse and brands
Analysing data to see for improvements
Creating Goods in notices

Marketing Support
Working with CMO to drive various elements of marketing
Building a database of influencers, working with them to publish content for partners
Learning about Digital Marketing and supporting in German marketing plans.
Supporting with content creation
Learning about Facebook, Instagram, Google ads, email marketing and more

You will also be expected to support in other adhoc roles. As a small fast growing team we all muck in and do lots of things, your role will be no different!


To succeed in this role you should:

Be able to speak German fluently.
Have excellent copywriting and communication skills
Be interested in learning more about how industries like ecommerce and marketing work
Be creative with outstanding attention to detail
Be highly organised and self-motivated
Be driven and able to work proactively by yourself

Our benefits include:

Your birthday off and 20 days holiday per year
Lunch out on the company each month!

NW London office meters away from Golders Green station.
If we sound like the kind of company you’d like to be a part of, then we would love to hear from you!

You MUST be eligible to work in the UK and have strong written and verbal English communication skills.

items.content:
Social media spicy meme master / Content writer / Junior Marketing all-rounder

Make social media marketing tools vaguely-not-rubbish again!

Sked Social helps companies from small businesses to huge global brands do a better job managing their social media, particularly Instagram.

We've been doing this for over 5 years now, and continue to grow as more people discover the power of our visual marketing platform.

Our team of ~25 is spread across the world, so we can hire the best talent no matter where you are or want to be.

Our marketing team is looking for a junior/mid-level all-rounder, with a focus on writing and social media management/community management.

About you:


  • You love social media and technology. You'd inject Twitter or Instagram into your veins if you could (please do not try this). You get into the depths of all the weird parts of the internet, and you're not afraid by it (maybe a little).
  • You understand the social media sphere: you know what's trending before it trends, and you know how companies succeed and fail when using it. You're either excited or confused about MoonPie on Twitter.
  • You've got some marketing know-how and experience. That might be a course, but it might be professional through marketing or any related field (journalism, advertising, PR, communications…).
  • You can write like a boss, and understand the idea of having an editorial voice. You know what it's like to write with someone else's voice as well as your own.
  • You aren't afraid to speak up and have opinions. Our company is all about ensuring the best outcomes for the team and customers, and the best ideas are not limited to seniority or role.
  • You pay attention to the little things – making sure that things are done right, and not leaving the little things behind.
  • You understand the balance of being data-driven and having creativity, because one doesn't always trump the other.
  • You're relatively new to marketing – we're aiming to hire someone who is new(ish) and wants to join a growing company and learn by doing.


Your responsibilities:


  • You'll manage our social media accounts – Facebook, Twitter, Instagram. You'll know when to jump on a trending meme and when doing so will feel a bit "how do you do fellow kids".
  • You will work on establishing a consistent voice for Sked (and our mascot Quirky the Quokka).
  • You'll build a community around the Sked brand through our existing customers as well as attracting new ones.
  • You'll write for our blog about Instagram, the latest social media news and broadly social media strategy. You'll do this when news breaks, when customers need to understand part of the ecosystem or just because you've found something you are fascinated with.
  • Finally, you'll help our team across all other areas of marketing – both just to help the team, but also because you want to learn and our successes are a shared effort. That might include reporting, SEO, paid advertising, email newsletters and more.

You will need to have at least 4-5 hours overlap each day with Melbourne, Australia time (8am-6pm MEL hours). Otherwise, you can be located anywhere in the world.

This is a full time role (ie we aren't looking for someone working 5 other jobs) with a 3 month contract to start with.

How to apply


Apply online through our portal (link below!).

Include a cover letter with brief (essay not required but any format accepted) answers to:

  1. Why do you want to join the Sked team for this role? What makes you a good fit?
  2. What is your favourite social network, who do you think is most important to follow and why?
  3. What's the biggest news in the Instagram ecosystem you've seen recently?
  4. What do you think the worst thing is about social media today?

The salary guide for this role is USD$40k - we also have a profit share program, paid time off and more.

items.content:
SEO strategist and "chief do-er", lover of SERPs and all things organic search

We are a B2B software as a service tool that helps people schedule content on social media.

We are looking for someone to lead our more specialised SEO efforts internally, on a full or part time (at least 2 days a week) basis, with an initial 3 month contract.

What we're looking for


We are looking for someone who:

  • Lives their day inside Ahrefs/SEMrush/Clearscope etc
  • Loves to take a very technical and metrics-focussed approach to SEO
  • Wants to take on a challenge, with competitive keywords
  • Can lead the efforts internally from strategy to execution.
  • Has experience in the B2B SaaS space, ideally in a marketing focussed tool.

We would like to find someone who is willing to get their hands dirty and can manage the SEO process end-to-end so that you can keep the feedback loops fast.

When/if you run out of time to DIY, we can talk about adding extra people or contractors to be able to free up your time.

For us it's important though that you aren't afraid to get your hands dirty and that you have recent experience "doing the work", not just setting strategy.

You will need to have at least 2-3 hours overlap in working hours (8am-6pm) of Melbourne, Australia time, but otherwise our team is fully remote distributed around the world.

What you'll work on

Your first 1-2 weeks will be focussed on auditing our existing activities and identifying what the quick wins might be for the best keywords to generate revenue.

Then you'll work on implementing your thoughts alongside our team, with a focus on a keyword list of 10-20 high quality and high intent keywords you have researched that you think will create the best ROI for us.

You'll regularly report on progress as we climb up the SERPs, and likely contribute to various other campaigns and projects our team works on.

Salary guide

We're pricing this role at US$55-60k per annum (pro-rata if you work part time) – we also have a profit share program, paid time off and more.

Visit our application page linked from this ad.

items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Full-time
New York, NY
Remote job
Relocation assistance
Startup
Posted Today – Accepting applications
At Skillshare, we’re building a global community of curious, lifelong learners. Our Mobile Team plays a key role in our ability to scale by building apps that make our classes and learning community available to anyone, anywhere. We design for users around the world, in various contexts—whether sitting on a train, or their couch in front of the TV—with the goal of making learning seamlessly accessible.
 
We’re excited to welcome a seasoned Senior Product Designer who will design our mobile efforts across iOS, Android, and TV. Working closely with Engineering, Product, and as a member of the Design Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the mobile user experience with a highly collaborative team and by conducting/leading your own user research.
 
The Mobile Team is poised to grow significantly over the next year and you’ll help lead the charge. We’ll look to your expertise in designing consumer-facing mobile products and your ability to work seamlessly with teams across the company, champion the user, and drive real impact as we scale.

What you’ll do:
    • Work closely with Engineering, Product, and Design leaders to develop ongoing mobile strategy and roadmaps
    • Maintain and design new product features in our iOS and Android apps
    • Design and launch new TV apps experience (Apple TV, Android TV, Roku, etc.)
    • Own mobile design while working closely with web teams to unify the brand’s user experience, design system, and working towards feature parity between our web and mobile apps where applicable
    • Work with Product to interpret large bodies of qualitative and quantitative data on customer usage patterns to uncover new product insights and ideas
Why we’re excited about you:
    • 5+ years of experience designing web and mobile applications, ideally in a startup working in an Agile environment
    • Deep knowledge of app design and UI conventions across both iOS and Android (experience building TV apps a plus)
    • A digital portfolio showcasing your skills in UX, Visual & Motion design
    • Ability to own Design from a brainstorming session, user research, prototyping, usability testing, and working with Product & Engineering to build and ship successful products
    • You are continuously honing your craft as a Product Designer by learning new skills, adopting new tools, and sharing your efforts to the benefit of a stronger Design team
    • “Details are the design” is your mantra
Why you’re excited about us:
    • Impact: Mobile is a major company priority and you’ll have the chance to lead the charge.
    • Our team: We have a passionate, talented team that is a lot of fun to work with.
    • Our mission: We’re doing work that matters – connecting lifelong learners around the world and empowering them to pursue their creativity.
    • Flexibility: We believe that doing your best work means living a full life. That means different things for everyone, so we optimize for trust, invest to support remote teams, have an unlimited vacation policy (with a required minimum!), and encourage work-life balance.

Skillshare is an online learning community whose mission is to connect curious, lifelong learners everywhere – and, in so doing, build a more creative, more generous, and more prosperous world. Today, our community has grown to millions of members who come to Skillshare to learn creative and entrepreneurial skills, network with peers, and even teach a class themselves. We are backed by Union Square Ventures, Spark Capital, Amasia, Spero Ventures, and Burda Principal Investments.
 
Skillshare is committed to building a diverse team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We work to ensure a consistent interview process,  fair compensation, and inclusive work environment for all.

Demand Generation Manager at Chili Piper

Remote | International

Location: Brooklyn New York United States
Employment Type: Full-time

ALL ROLES AT CHILI PIPER ARE REMOTE SO YOU CAN WORK FROM ANYWHERE

Chili Piper is looking for an experienced Demand Generation Manager. This role plays a critical part of the success of the lead generation programs, wear many hats, and interact with various roles inside and outside of the marketing department. You are a strategist, an analyst, a project manager, and a campaign manager. If you eat, sleep, and breathe creating lots of qualified leads for the Sales team driven from marketing campaigns, then we want to meet you!

Ultimately you are self-motivated and have a proven track record of effectively working across multiple departments to create campaigns, programs, and processes that drive qualified leads to Sales.

The ideal candidate for this position will have significant experience in demand generation, inbound and outbound marketing strategy and execution, and experience with Salesforce and marketing automation systems (Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, etc…).

Qualifications:

  • Generate a robust marketing pipeline and effectively track and understand marketing funnel KPIs. Own the funnel for various campaigns.
  • Create and execute effective marketing campaigns and programs that drive large lead volumes to support new customer acquisition targets
  • Collaborate withsales to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both prospects and customers. Map content and marketing collateral to the buyer’s journey and create conversion paths on websites and landing pages.
  • Develop a marketing and sales SLA and work with marketing operations to optimize the leadconversion process. Collaborate with SDRs to help drive leads through the marketing funnel.
  • Drive SEM, SEO, keyword, and list or segmentation strategies.
  • Develop display marketing campaigns, paid social, and other sponsored content plays as needed.
  • Develop and implement marketing campaigns for conferences
  • Build and optimize current nurture programs for various inbound marketing activities.
  • Own and take full accountability of life cycle email, direct mail and high-touch event marketing programs from strategy to execution including some direct marketing writing.
  • Develop and analyze key marketing metrics to ensure campaigns are meeting engagement, Experience building campaigns, analyzing key marketing metrics, and developing strategy for prospect and existing customer marketing programs.
  • Organized, self-starter, with strong interpersonal skills to work effectively and build strong relationships with cross-functional business partners.
  • Experience in authoring and building targeted marketing campaigns and presentations to support strategy.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and related communications simultaneously and within budget.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Experience/Skills

  • Minimum 4-6 years of relevant work experience managing inbound and outbound marketing campaigns.
  • Hands-on marketing automation platform experience preferred.
  • Experience marketing SaaS and/or technology offerings in B2B.
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field

Additional Information:

How We Work

We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.
  • Autonomy and ownership.Working on a distributed team means you dont have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure youre getting things done. Were a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.
  • Be helpful.Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

  • Generous Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance

items.title: Tutuka: Global Product & Communications Leader
items.content:
Global Product & Communications Leader

Over many fast-growing years at Tutuka, we’ve created products that our clients and partners love. While our strategy has been successful to date, we are looking to take our approach to Product and Communications to a fundamentally new level. If you are a dynamic, ambitious Global Product & Communications Leader, who is excited by the payments market and experienced in working in a remote team, then keep reading.

As Global Product and Communications Leader, you will be working directly with the CEO of Tutuka and will have the unique opportunity to shape Tutuka by seizing the reigns of a key part of our strategy, as well as growing the products that are already disrupting payments in emerging markets. This is a role where you will have lots of opportunity to experiment and help the team find solutions, and then scaling and integrating them into our business.

This involves working closely with the client service and new business teams to launch new products that differentiate Tutuka and highlight Tutuka’s user-friendly payment services. Building out Tutuka’s product roadmap with a commercial view, while working with various teams throughout the business ensuring everyone is moving towards the same goal.

At Tutuka we thrive on making things happen and this is reflected in our approach and culture.  This role would suit a self-sufficient product leader who also has some communication and pricing experience. As a fast-growing company you will need to grow a team while rolling up your sleeves up on the various product initiatives. You will have the opportunity to travel as a key part of this role, in order to see our teams in Johannesburg, Dubai and Bangkok as well as our international clients (up to 25% of your time).

In a nutshell:

This is an opportunity to work directly with our CEO and the rest of our management team to define how Tutuka grows products and sets our strategic direction for communications and pricing. You will lead and grow a team. There would be the possibility for this position to be fast-tracked to the global management team – that’s in your hands.

Product:
  • Own and build the product roadmap and have full ownership of the product iteration and delivery process
  • Bridge the gap between the client service, new business, commercial and technical teams
  • Deeply understand Tutuka’s customers, how they use our products, the problems they encounter, and the opportunities the business has for providing them with better products
  • Deep knowledge of payments trends and regulatory changes

Pricing:
  • Partner with a Pricing Analyst in the team to develop a coherent pricing strategy for Tutuka’s products
  • Guide the Pricing Analyst to develop a process to gather and use market pricing information on a recurring basis

Communication:
  • Partner with a Global Communications Manager in the team to develop briefs and insights that will enable Tutuka to build better product communications
  • With the Global Communications Managers:
  • Clearly communicate complex product features and benefits by taking a user-friendly and global approach
  • Scale our product storytelling and translate the complexity of Tutuka’s products into pitches and stories that expand what people think of when they hear “Tutuka”
  • Incorporate product strategy into our communication strategy
  • Overall accountability for Tutuka’s external and internal communication strategy and delivery as part of the product role

You have:
  • 8+ years of having led the development of data-intensive based products, including at least 4+ years of managing a product team
  • Ideally worked both in corporate and start-up environments – you understand corporate structures but you also like to get your hands dirty
  • An excellent track record of taking products to market and optimising existing products
  • A commercial mindset in order to understand the impact of new products and pricing
  • Some experience with incorporating User Experience thinking into product design would be helpful
  • Some experience in API driven products would also be helpful
  • A drive to succeed, and a passion for taking on new challenges and making them your own
  • The ability to deal effectively with ambiguity and thrive in an unstructured, fast-moving environment
  • A proven ability to build strong collaborative working relationships with team members
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems
  • Great influencing and strong decision-making skills
  • Great leadership qualities and a willingness to develop and share a vision for your work

If this feels like it was written for you, then please get in touch and apply. 

Tutuka looks to build strong, diverse teams built from different backgrounds, experiences and identities.
